review: i think CPK worths more than 3 stars but adding the food and service.  we came here on a friday night bc Cheese cake factory was packed, and this place is right next to it. after waiting for 5 minutes, we got seated. I tried the italian soda, which is flavored soda with cream. I changed to another tea after having a zip of that soda. Food is decent, i recommend the vegetarian pizza with japanese eggplant. the baby broccoli gives a great texture for the entire pizza. My bf got the meat cravers thing, and he said it wasn't bad.  service was great. Our server was very nice and suggestive.

This place was very popular with my coworkers, so I ordered from here a lot. I found the staff to be very pleasant to deal with, and enjoyed the perks of getting free meals due to my large orders. However, I found the food to only be so-so which is a shame since I really liked their frozen pizzas over the last few years. Anyway, here is my thoughts on all of the food I've tried over the past few months: Carnitas and habenero pizza: Only OK overall, but the sauce/salsa that comes with it on the side is REALLY good. Spinach and broccoli soup: tastes like it came from a can - Campbell's to be exact.  Pesto Chicken thin crust pizza: Just OK. chicken tequila fettucine - it was pretty bland. The "jalapeno cream sauce" tasted like just a white sauce. The peppers in it tasted fresh and good, but didn't save it.  Japanese eggplant pizza - My husband liked this well enough, especially the mushrooms, but I didn't like it overall chicken club sandwich: It was decent, but would have been much more enjoyable had the bread been warm. But that might just be because I ordered it to-go. Hawaiian pizza on thin crust.: The toppings on this were good. I only wish their thin crust was crispy rather than soft. I'd gotten used to their thin crust being crispy from the frozen pizzas. Update: Moroccan chicken salad - this salad is amazing!! I absolutely love it and have ordered it twice now, and will order again. A few more entrees like this and I'll have to give the place an additional star.

I have yet to eat inside this location but have ordered take out for myself and my boss numerous times. Their curbside take-out is super convenient. The mall parking can be crowded and takeout orders would not be the same without this service. I've had a few salads here and they have been wonderful. They are full of interesting ingredients and extremely flavorful. I also enjoy the thin crust margherita pizza.

The best things about them is they have one pizza which they can top half with Veg and another with non veg , or any different combo u might like. That's a big advantage for couple like us where one is veggie and other likes non veg. Pizzas are super yummy. Also have tried there pasta , grilled fish ( salmon), over all they all wee good but they do lack consistency and you might not find same taste each time. Service is nice.

This is the only CPK I've dined at, except for the one in Las Vegas McCarran Int'l Airport, and I wouldn't expect much from that as it's not even a full-service location. So based on my multiple instances here (people's birthday dinners, lunches with friends, etc.) I've been coming here for quite a few years. I'm not here often, but my multiple visits seem to have added up. The pizza is always delicious. The crust could use a hand or two, but the actual toppings and cheese and stuff makes it really delicious. I love the chipotle chicken pizza, chicken bbq, buffalo chicken, and a few more I can't remember. The good thing about this place is that it ends up being really cheap when you share. Went to a friend's birthday dinner, we ordered 3 or 4 pizzas and fed six people with under $45. Not bad at ALL. So yeah, great place, the service is fine, never noticed it being bad or good. It's just average.

At California Pizza Kitchen, I ordered for my wife and I their Five Cheese Pizza w/ Fresh Tomatoes and Thai Crunch Salad.  Photos attached. The Five Cheese Pizza with Fresh Tomatoes is worth 5 stars. Bling.  It was delicious from first to last bite.  Its taste is 10x the value for which it is priced.  If it were a company, it would be grossly undervalued and potentially capable of shaking up the Dow Jones Index of blue chip companies. The Thai Crunch Salad is an interesting although colorful but sad salad.  It  resembled Ramen Noodles in a foam cup that was then easily plopped on a plate.  All that remained was adding boiled water. Ramen Noodles can be found at a local grocery store for about $1 for 4 cups of noodles.  The Thai Salad tasted fair at best.  However, it is over priced.   Service earns a mix review:  Our host at CPK appeared lost and distracted while at work.  Our waitress was polite and courteous.  Yet, she is unfamiliar about menu items, nor is she confident to make menu recommendations. Food was delivered timely.  Follow up service to refill tea and water orders was frequent.  A dessert menu and options was offered. Turning CPK around to pick up the remaining 2 stars (out of 5 stars) requires subtle changes and minimal upgrades: 1. Service from wait staff ranges from poor to elementary.  Train to create a uniform level of service that is on path to proficient.  Sales will bolster and tips will run with rises in sales. 2. Upgrade from paper napkins to cloth napkins.  It would compliment the alcohol and wine purchases patrons make to compliment their meal. 3. Reinvent the Thai Crunchy Salad. I wish CPK best in luck and skill to earn the remaining stars.   - Esteban

Overall very positive visit.  Restaurant was  a little noisy, but it was very busy.  Service was average, but timely.  The Jerk Chicken   Pizza  on thin crust was excellent.  One of the best I've ever had.  Only a bit more Jerk sauce would have gotten the 5th star from me. We will definitely be back here soon.

The service has improved :) I have frequent this CPK many times and I generally order the same thing at both Houston locations. This location is a bit oddly shaped for lack of better words. It wasn't busy either :T Galleria is better than Memorial Nonetheless, this place killed my pizza craving. When I entered the restaurant, I caught an employee (possibly hostess) off guard. I believe she was ready to leave for the day but she stopped to grab menus, and sat me in a nearby booth. I give her mad props for keeping it professional and taking care of guests first.  Although I was waiting for my friend's arrival, my server EMMA promptly greeting me and took my drink order. I had wanted to surprise my friend with a birthday sundae and she was really sweet to keep it a surprise. After my friend's arrival and placement of the order, Emma offered a complimentary basket of sourdough bread and butter. I feel that she went above and beyond because from my understanding, it's only brought out upon request. We didn't have much a problem with refills either. Emma even waited for my friend to turn his head at the end of the meal so that she could run out with the surprise. That's just AWESOME!  The food itself is pretty consistent. I love my California Club on a thin crust. :) Overall a delightful experience. Not a lot of negatives... I know I didn't write any but they're not perfect just yet... There's room for improvement but with this kind of service at the mall... I might start skipping passed that food court :)

Eh, it's okay. It's an overpriced mall foodplace. No excuse for the standalone locations though.  It's a Pepsi place, so not off to a great start. They've added some cool little appetizers, which is cool, and some of them are fairly decent. I like the hummus and they have a couple eggroll things - I can't remember the flavors, but one is delish, and one is weird. The pizzas are good enough and the salads can be really good (I like the Chicken Cobb), but they are huge. I went with just my kid and it might have been smarter to split something instead of letting him order off the kids' menu. They have a .99 sundae on the kids' menu, and that made my kiddo pleased as anything. I'm sure this place will only get more popular as American Girl opens up soon

Service was great! Refills for my mango iced tea kept coming without being asked. The server also brought plates and new plates without being asked. I also noticed that the manager on duty was attentive to every table. He was always asking if everyone was enjoying their meal. The food is always good here, but not extravagant (why it's not 5 stars). I enjoyed the chicken tequila fettucine (I think that's what it is)... it had a hint of a lime-y creamy Alfredo sauce... sort of like a delicious curry tossed in with noodles. YUMMY. I also enjoyed the avocado egg rolls. I love avocado so I knew that I couldn't go wrong with that. It similar to BJ's.  The BBQ chicken pizza is also a must! I love pineapples on my pizza, and the bbq just added more zest, along with the onions. I always get this here. I will be coming back, especially since the service improved since my last visit.

The closest food place inside the mall to the ice rink. While the pizza is decent, it's very fast food feel and not too expensive. The works gets you a supreme that has all the toppings but doesn't taste as great as a properly cooked meat pie. For example, the bell peppers are raw, lack of tomato sauce and the bare application of cheese. It's like a sit down at Pizza Hut when it should be better.
Kids love the fire and to see the kitchen, pens and paper for them. Arugula and pear pizza was delicious. Sauce and pasta ok. Staff great.

Its a chain restaurant so it's not amazing food, but it's decent. I really like the White Corn Guacamole and chips- YUMM!!  The Pesto Cream Penne- is also pretty good. Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake -is super delicious but I love anything chocolaty!  I also really like their Red Apple-berry Sangria.

Well, I really wanted to like this place. The atmosphere is very inviting and it has a great location if you want to do a little shopping in the memorial area, particularly the mall. Recently went with a group of four and we all left with a similar feeling of "Ehh". Overall the food was unimpressive. We started with the "guacamole" which was actually a chunky salsa of roasted corn, black beans, tomatoes and a few pieces of avacoda in it. Not really a guacamole, but good flavors. Our opinion of it was basically "Well, thats pretentious!" It wasn't bad, just not as described. The pizzas that we ordered (Original BBQ and Margherita Pizza) were both just OK. The BBQ chicken had a very flavorful sauce, but the chicken was bland and the crust soggy in the middle. The Margherita pizza was good, with big chunks of mozarella and sliced fresh basil on top. The crust on this one was cooked more consistently. I think for a chain pizza place they did an ok job, but with so many other restaurants in the area I probably won't pick this one again.
Good drinks, good service, decent pizza, convenient location (when you're shopping).

We love California Pizza Kitchen.  Lots of really good, different and interesting salads available in both full and half sizes.   Also, many unusual pizza offerings which are also excellent.  They have other things on the menu also but I have never tried them because I never get passed the salads or pizzas.  Discovered it first in Santa Barbara, CA but they are uniformly good everywhere.     The only possible blemish is the service is sometimes spotty, but this is due to inexperienced trying to hard.  I wish they had locations closer to home and to work. Today we had the Spicy Korean Barbeque Pizza.   I thought it was great.  My wife thought it was good but that the Kimchi salad topping was too spicy so she scrapped it off.  Note: While I like spicy I'm  not one of those over the top love extra spicy people.

Incredibly slow service.  The food was good but not worth the wait. Drinks stay at the bar until they were totally watered down.  Never got the additional bread we asked for.  I won't be coming back here.

I've been coming here for years, not always this location.  Considering it is a chain restaurant their pizza is pretty darn good! My favorite has always been the bbq chicken, it's so delicious! I love the red onions and the sweet bbq sauce, the flavors all go together really well. This last time I went I decided to take the plunge and try something new, so I went for their spicy chicken chipoltle pizza. Normally when this happens I'm always disappointed, in this case I was glad that I went for it! They offer their original crust, thin crust and even wheat crust pizza, 2 thumbs up for that!

The service here was great! Food came quickly and we were checked up on quite a bit. I usually order the salads here and they never seem to disappoint. The half size will fill you up for sure! Also, their desserts are to die for. SO DELICIOUS. The only reason that they receive a 4 star rating from me is because their pizza isn't as great as I expected it to be. Considering the name is California PIZZA kitchen I thought it would be outstanding, not just 'good'.

After our last review, we were contacted by the management and asked to return to this restaurant to give them another shot.  We finally had business in this part of town, so we came in.  Upon arrival we contacted the manager to let them know this was a second chance for them to impress.  The service was attentive, the restaurant clean, and the food tasty.  We were neither ignored or forgotten this visit.  The waiter nervously informed us that one of our pizzas had accidentally burned, but they had a replacement out in no time at all.  This establishment has redeemed itself to me and my group.  Should this quality be repeated, they may get a fifth star from me yet.

The service was excellent, and I was pleasantly surprised at the Italian deli sandwich with Caesar salad. The bread was fresh and the hint of basil took it over the top. The meat tasted fresh too, like it had been cut to order (though I can't be sure). The greens were cold and crisp. The croutons were crispy, not stale like the ones I typically get. I will definitely be going back. I may even try the pizza next time!

They had great pizza we ordered the BLT pizza and i thought it was great with soft and crispy crust. I really enjoyed the Mediterranean bread dip as well.  Our service was good also even though we got there at shift change it didnt stop the hostess from making sure we got to order drinks and appetizers before our server got to us. When she got to our table the transition was seamless. At this location they have "seats" for American Girl dolls which was a HUGE surprise due to bringing my daughter and her friends dolls they just got from the AG store. They loved that so this is a huge bonus. If i had to say one thing that i was like "hmmmm" about is that the table right next to the door and hostess station had a fork that literally stayed on the floor while myself (on my way to the restroom), servers. hostess, and other guest had to step over to walk down the aisle. Pick up the fork! lol Overall my first time at a California Pizza Kitchen and i was very happy with my experience and if in the area again i would revisit.
Pizza post thanksgiving not that busy here on Black Friday

Love me some CPK! This restaurant is pretty cool, as in cold so make sure to wear a sweater! I'm freezing right now! Good thing the delicious pizza will warm me up! If you visit the restaurant frequently then sign up for their rewards club, they send you coupons for free mini apps. If you're visiting the American Girl store they have cute little pink high chairs for dolls to sit in while you eat.  My only issue was tonight they put the order for the pizza in too early and we just had gotten our salads. By the time we were ready to eat it it was soggy and cold. We notified the waitress and she said it was no issue and took it away to have another one made.
I usually get the avocado egg rolls, and the Thai chicken pizza, which is amazing. They can get busy at times, but service is good.

The food was flawless. It was our best trip to CPK. My 2 small children shared a kids Hawaiian pizza. My husband and I split some delicious Thia Chicken Lettuce Wraps and a half BBQ Chicken/ Half Thia Chicken Pizza. My family went on a Tuesday night at 6:30, and then took the kids to the awesome (free) kids play area in the a attached mall (for those under 48").
Pizzas are good here but I feel like the ones are star pizza is better and during lunch time u can get a salad for for the same price as cpk. Will not be coming back.
Looks like there has been an increase in menu prices since I was last here... Most pizzas are around $12-$13 now. And full order salads around the same.  I guess that comes with inflation.

Guest 1 - The Works hand tossed pizza  The ingredients (Italian sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, mozzarella, pecorino Romano, spinach and bacon) were not sauteed,  simply thrown on top of the pizza after the crust was baked. There was an abundance of veggies which were largely sliced. Many were left on the plate. Guest 2 - Five Cheese + fresh tomato hand tossed pizza  This entree was made perfectly and not a crumb was left behind.  Mmm... Guest 3 - Chicken Tequila Fettuccine Another perfectly made dish. I had been craving pasta and this definitely hit the spot. The sauce truly was its secret weapon.  I'd order this again. 2 out of 3 three meals were terrific. That's not bad. Wish the prices were better though. For 3 meals, 2 lemonades, and 1 ice tea = $60. That's a bit pricey in my opinion.
Their california pizza and waldorf salad is the best!

Great food and service. The management team is always greeting guest and ensuring the food is made to perfection. Jose was pur server and he was great always on task and friendly. Andrew and Lacy are managers that make you feel welcomed.

Absolutely wonderful atmosphere & service!!!!!!  1st and foremost my server CELESTE was astonishing! !!!!! Such a wonderful young woman w a beautiful smile & the best customer service I've received ANYWHERE.  I TIPPED HER MORE THAN MY MEAL COST,  THAT'S HOW DELIGHTFUL IT WAS TO SEE SOMEONE SO CHEERFUL & ENJOY WHAT THEY DO. I WAS A BIT GLUM & FEELING ILL BUT SHE BRIGHTENED MY DAY.   The food was very good.   Caesar salad was not the beat I've had but it wasnt bad- 3.5 stars The pizza was phenomenal- 5 stars (just had a basic pepperoni)  Service was the best I've seen in a while anywhere
First time eating here. We tried a variety of things between the group. Shrimp lettuce wraps were good. The five cheese pizza was amazing. Sesame dumplings were phenomenal. Will be returning!

They have good pizzas here, for sure, it will never fail if you go for pizza. We also ordered a mango mojito and it tasted so good, definitely recommend this drink. Service was ok or under average, on the other hand. It was not a busy day, but our waitress seemed not to check on us frequently, not to mention that she was so serious(?!). We left not really happy but the food was above my expectation a little bit, that why I gave the place 4 stars. Will come back again and try one more time at this location. The pro thing about this place is it's so inconvenient, short walking distance to the mall and to the Cinemark. But beware, it can be crowded on weekend, I can tell.
Service was okay, but the made the kids pizza with broccoli  on it instead of on the side, so we waited 40 minutes for a replacement. The spinach dip was horrid.

Went with 7 co workers to have lunch. The food was good ok. The service was terrible. Our server not only forgot one of the orders but has the distinction of being the worst server my boss has ever had.  They had so many opportunities to save the situation and failed at them as well. If the manager came by, he didn't identify himself as such. Truly less than stellar experience.

I tried this place for the first time yesterday 8/06/2015.. I forgot my glasses "brand-new Ray bans" clearly they were visible when the waitress came to get her tip.. I  called back the next day and asked if anyone has seen them and they said no we haven't found anything.... clearly not the place to go back to...

Always friendly staff whether you're dining in or ordering to go. My company orders from them for lunch all of the time and they always have the food ready on time and are always curtious. Curb side pick up is great. Overall great place for a good drink and flat bread or a full on dinner or lunch meal. **Bartender was Eli today; very accomodating, hospitable,  and nice!
I always have a great time. Food is good service is awesome. I can't complain its a great place to come with the family.

I came here for lunch with a friend earlier today. Neither of us had particularly eaten at CPK more than once, and decided to give it another go. The wait staff was nice enough and the food is a little too bland for me. One thing that definitely turned me away for good, was the fact that toward the end of our lunch a huge dusty roach was crawling along the booth! Of course, I scurried away, because they're terrifying. We notified the staff, to which a server proceeded to grab a plate (for what, I don't know) and some napkins. The manager caught wind of the situation and merely told us that since the booth was located along the windows and carry-out door, roaches are prone to coming in and offered nothing more about the situation. Neither of them caught the roach, I'm guessing they hoped it just disappeared. Not exactly an ideal response, but definitely makes you wonder what's going on in the kitchen as well!

First off food was good. But bathroom smelled like vomit. There was dust and dirty window seals everywhere.   They also had a birthday party which backed the kitchen up. Would have been nice had the manager got some guacamole and chips out on people's table. Something that didn't involve the main oven.  I'll be back to cpk just probably not this location. I can get over having to wait 45 min for a pizza. But the dirty bathroom and restaurant I have to draw the line.

This was a tough review to write that's why I followed my history professor's advice of letting cooler heads prevail. After letting the food and the experience digest, I decided to go with the four star rating rather than a three. I had friends waiting for me waiting inside when I got there. The hostess seemed to be a little preoccupied with putting her fingers through her hair and looking more playful rather than attentive but I dashed right in waving at my friends without letting her have the chance to acknowledge me so maybe I should not be so critical of her.  After I seated myself, the server quickly approached me and asked me for my drink. She was on fleek. When one of us asked for the potato soup and they were out of it, she was quick to recommend the squash soup. It was everything I needed right there and then. *side note: I have not been to CPK since 2010 because I discovered that they stopped serving their Mango Chicken Tandoori Pizza in 2009. It was my absolutely favorite thing ever! I really hope that they bring it back!!! I came to this location back in 2010 after a breakup with my bff and I had bad memories associated with it but after the service I received this trip, I am a changed man* Minus one star for the really tasteless oil thing served with the bread. Call me an EVOO snob but that oil mixture served  with my bread lacked flavor like a fake Chanel at the Met Gala. We ordered the Sicilian and the Roasted Artichoke + Spinach with added chicken pizzas. I really like my vegetables and if anyone who knows me knows that I loved making my own pizza (dough made from scratch) but both pizzas were just oh so incredible. I don't eat pork products - mostly because they make my stomach hurt - but I not only broke my religious dietary code that night but I also decided to not follow my self inflicted dietary code and I am so glad I did. The Sicilian is one mean pizza and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to give meat pizzas a try. The dessert was just the right amount of rich. Although I couldn't stomach more than three spoonfuls, my bf and his brother loved every bite of it. All in all, coming to CPK after a nearly five year hiatus has made me a happy customer and I will definitely frequent it more often.  P.S. Y'all need to bring back the chicken tandoori pizza!

The hostess sat us right away at a table we liked. We waited a while for a server, I guess the hostess noticed because she offered to get our drinks. 5 minutes later our waiter, Trent, served our drinks and he took our orders. We had the spaghetti, hummus and pita bread, salad and the kids pizza. The food was good. Our waiter was excellent. The ambiance is pretty loud and busy given that the restaurant is in the mall and there are lots of family with kids. The bathrooms were in need of attention. Trash on the floors, a broken stall door, 2 stalls out of seat covers and toilet paper. We let the hostess know and they did fix the problem.

We visited the California pizza kitchen because it is next to the American girl doll store. We were Christmas shopping and it was next door.  We had the best waitress, she had a beautiful smile, and she was very friendly. She asked us if it was our first time visiting the restaurant. It was, so she said we could have our choice of appetizers for free!  We chose the corn and avocado dip. It was served with corn chips and I t had a sweet flavor. It was so good I want the recipe!   We ordered the margarita pizza. It was good but it was a little limp for thin crust.  It had plenty of tomatoes which my husband really liked   I will eat there again, if I'm ever at this mall again.

I dined at your establishment on Saturday night while Christmas shopping at memorial city. The hostess quoted us 15 minutes and it was probably less before she seated us. Our waitress was wonderful, she brought us everything we needed and went above and beyond. We ordered the bbq chicken pizza, Cajun pasta, soup, and wedge salad. The food was excellent and service was great. We left very happy with our leftovers. The reason I am rating one star is because it won't let me give zero stars. When I got home I immediately opened the pizza box to warm up a slice and to my surprise a small roach ran out of the box. It was one of those small ones that comes from being dirty. I was absolutely disgusted. We had taken home the rest of the pasta and 2 slices of pizza, needless to say, I dumped it in the trash and will no longer dine at this location. I understand things happen but roaches in to go food is beyond disgusting. Please check your Togo boxes and bags as maybe to prevent this from happening to other customers.

I ordered Thai chicken salad and asked no cucumbers.  My party was 11 people.  The waitress brought out food for the kids first..."good." Then brought out our friends food... "Ok."  They had pizza and pasta.  Waited 15 minutes before they came out to my wife and I and told her that her pizza was almost ready, and then went on to tell me that they couldn't make my salad without the cucumbers, and stood over me suggesting I make another choice.  The thing is I couldn't just choose anything, as I am on a diet and just spent 30 minutes before we choose our entree's looking at their nutrition guide online.  I was very frustrated and knew that this was not a decision I could make no matter how much I wanted to just eat anything by that time.  I had already seen in the nutrition guide that everything else was over 1000 calories and I would be doing myself no favors to pick something hesitantly.  I told her no thank you.  I ended up having to walk a good way to the center of the mall where I got an overpriced salad that was by far not any good.  My wife finally got her pizza.  The chef came out and apologized and comped her pizza.  Needless to say this situation was a domino effect to a horrible evening.  They really should have told me when I ordered the good or shortly thereafter that they couldn't accommodate my request so that I could have made different decisions before everyone had gotten their food.

The mushroom pizza was disappointing. Also, I sent back my strawberry basil martini because I didn't expect the basil aspect of the drink to be just a leaf floating in my drink. The drink itself was grossly strawberry juice flavored. No basil muddled in what so ever. If I paid $8+ for a drink I expect more... Along with the pizza I ordered a fancy salad...doesn't matter what kind because I never received it. I didn't bother mentioning it to the server because the pizza was bland and I figured the salad wouldn't be any better. She didn't know any better and CHARGED us for the damn salad anyways. Wth? I'm pretty sure we were her only table as it wasn't busy that night so you'd think she'd notice if she forgot to bring out a damn entree or not... Boyfriend ordered a $24 steak and he said it tasted burnt... Why's the food so sucky for such a fancy menu?? I don't get it...but I'm glad I tried it because I now know it's not worth it!!
Got the lunch special, pizza and soup. Pizza was pretty good and freshly made. Pea and barley soup was very good and not too salt like most soups. Overall a pretty good place for lunch.
The pizza is here made just the way I like. Thin and crispy. The staff is friendly. Plus is connected to my favorite mall.

Business on a Saturday was busy and congested. We were a party of five and were happy to wait the twenty minutes to be seated. Upon being seated, we were given a table for three. There was some miscommunication between the hostess and the seating server. Although upsetting, we spoke with the manager, Diana, who was very courteous and moved us into the first spot that would accommodate our group. While waiting we were able to put in our orders. The food was pleasant. Nothing remarkable about the dishes. Our server, Tim, was great. His sense of humor shined and his interactions with us were enjoyed.  We put in two separate, single item, drink orders; both were out of stock. Diana, checking in on us before we left made up for the missed drink orders by giving us a bottle of wine to take and a piece of ref velvet cake (great cake. Overall, it is the customer service that deserves kudos, not the dishes. Thanks again to Diana and Tim.

What a disgusting disappointment. We came in today and were told to sit at the bar because they had no tables open (this is where the trouble starts)... The only thing was that there was a booth and multiple tables available. However, we decided to bite the bullet at sit at the bar. This is when the less than par service began.  We ordered two pizzas and watched them get prepared. Now as my pizza was ready the bar tender who had touched, money, her cell phone, wiped her nose and was handling multiple beer tabs stuck her hand in the basil and then PUT IT ON MY PIZZA. How unsanitary and DISGUSTING is that?!  Worst part, this was all happening while the male manager and female manager were present. You would think they would care a little more seeing as I was sitting right there, nope! And the irony, oh the irony, that there was a box of plastic gloves RIGHT THERE.  DISGUSTING. I will not be back!

The food was good but the service was poor. We were served our appetizers and bread with our drinks. When the food arrived the table was not cleared and the pizza pasta and additional plates were added to the table. When I asked our server for a spoon for my toddler to eat her pasta she told us "just wait a minute". Several minutes later she bought the spoon back. The toddler spilled a drink on the crowed table. I cleaned it up with the paper towels and wrapped it in a placemat. I stood up from the table she walked up to me and I tried to had her the dry placemat. She stepped back and told me to wait and left me holding the placemat. I will be visiting another location next time.

I went here about a week ago weekday well past lunch time rush. It was not busy by any means. Ill just with go with pros and cons and not a story, that will be longer.  Pros: they boxed our left overs.  -- food slightly above average. Pizza was partly burnt.  Cons: By far one of the worst service we've had.   --Waitstaff and Bartender saw us and didn't even try to get anyone to sit us.  --we didn't have utensils so we tried to get a waitstaffs attention. He was 10 ft away and didn't even look at us. He in LaLaLand. Blond haired kid.  --I ordered ice tea that never came and was asked if i still want it after we were all done.  --Waitstaff should be cleaning their tables. Specially when its not busy and they are just standing there. There were many tables that need to be bussed. Later on we saw someone bussing, didn't not look like the server, maybe a manager.  We don't in going here again. Corporate needs to get this location checked.

Well I am a overall fan of California pizza kitchen. I love all the flavor combinations of their pizzas. My favorite being the bbq chicken pizza. The spinach dip is delicious but eat it before it cools down as it tends to conjeal.  In my opinion the orchard sangria was not worth the $9 at all!  Absolutely no alcohol, tons of ice, served in a tall, thin glass unlike what the pictured depicted and unlike what a sangria is typically served in. Go for the food and you'll be alright.

Food is really good. The customer service matters who's serving you and what chef is in that day. The waiters seem to be competing on who gets to serve us. Went with my best friend and we were confused on who to tip since two waiters were competing on who could bring our food out first. I went again with my two friends and the waiter brought our check split in thirds after asking him to make sure the checks were based on who ordered what. It made it harder for us to figure out how much we were supposed to pay for our own plates. On the bright side, there is this one chef who gave us the best service ever. I think he's the head chef so he clearly knows what he's doing. The waiting line isn't too long but it can get quite busy some weekends since its next to a mall.

I used to eat at this specific CPK all the time when I was younger and it honestly brings back so many great memories for me. Many years have passed, and the food and service have changed into something completely opposite of my childhood pizza wonderland.  My bf and I have eaten here twice in the past year or so. The first time wasn't half bad! We both enjoyed the Sicilian flatbread pizza and the chicken tequila pasta. The second time (aka today), however, was just terrible.  Our server's name was Luisa and she was just terribly awkward. She would ask us questions and when we would reply INSTANTLY, she would stare into our souls for about 3 seconds before replying back...Weird. Anyway, we decided upon the Hawaiian pizza and the chicken alfredo, (can't remember the exact name) both of which were unappetizing. The Hawaiian pizza was really greasy and did not have fresh pinapples on it. The least they could have given me for a 6 piece, $15 pizza... The pasta had a very little amount of chicken and tasted sort of off. Can't really explain it, maybe it was just me. All in all, we weren't satisfied with the food we ordered.  Luisa took forever to give us the check and forever to pick it up afterwards. Really annoying considering that there was barely anyone in the restaurant and we just wanted to get out of there. I can't believe how much this place has changed since I was younger. The prices are way too high for Olive Garden quality food and the service that we received was just ridiculous. I don't plan on returning.

I never want to leave a bad review for any business, especially since I really liked their Wild Mushroom Pizza, but jesus THEIR DESSERT MADE ME ILL! My friend and I had their butter cake over 9 hours ago and both of us are still sick to our stomach! We were fine with their pizzas but after we had the cake we both thought our stomachs were hurting because we were full, but after 9 hours, and no other food I've eaten the rest of the day, there was nothing else that could make me this sick to my stomach. I don't know what happened or what they did to the cake that I got but I'm never coming back here again

The pizza wasn't saucy enough and was pretty bland. The food was very mediocre, I would prefer Pizza Hut or Papa John's if I'm looking for good tasting pizza. However I did enjoy the Caesar salad. I probably won't be back here, but at least I tried! Update: I'd like to point out that I've eaten at California Pizza Kitchen in the past, and I really enjoy the pasta. I just wasn't blown away by the pizza but I would recommend a lot of other options on the menu. But with the word "pizza" in their name I expected more in that regard.

My wife suggested we eat here because she heard the food was good. We were seated by the hostess. After 15 minutes of nobody approaching our table and employees at the far table talking and not working, we got up and left. I was going to let the hostess know on the way out, but she wasn't there. I stopped one of the employees that walked out from behind the counter and asked to speak with a manager. He came back with the hostess who was also the manager, I guess. I told her what happened and she just replied, "OK". No apology at all. We left from there. BTW, they were not busy, at all. Unless they had a drive-thru that I couldn't see.   I would recommend they hire a new manager that will stay on the floor and make sure customers are taken care of! Incident date 08/15/2016 Incident time 5:00PM

Our server, Austen, was just attentive enough, not too much. The pizza was good, and the tea was fine. The only issue I had was that the Caesar salad was not too fresh -- and we were there at the peak of lunch hour. The lettuce seemed like something out of a bag, or left over from last night.
Come and meet Johnny the new manager at memorial location.  He knows restaraunt menu very well! Will be back as long as he is here for sure!

I really love pizza so there is no possible way to get it wrong.  California pizza kitchen is one of those places that I would say likes to do fusion pizzas but not really setting itself apart from other pizza places around town.  Also, in my opinion they are a bit pricey.  I ordered the carne asada pizza and while I did enjoy the flavors and salsa, it simply reminded me of a quesadilla only that they charged me $20 for a small pizza.  The cheese pizza was also pricey and nothing extradordinary.  I have had better pizza, this was just ok for me.

I came here with a friend after a night movie (also at Memorial City Mall) and it was packed and super noisy. We got a table after a short wait but were surrounded by large parties of people. Screaming kids and loud adults don't make for an appealing dinner atmosphere at all. The pizzas here are pricey but me and my friend aren't huge eaters so we each got a kids size personal pizza from the kids menu which filled us up nicely and wasn't expensive. We also got crayons and a coloring page even though we were clearly adults. Our waiter decided to humor us and we appreciated that.

This review is strictly for my last visit which was Veteran's Day 2016. I ordered from the VD menu ... Hawaiian pizza. I also got the chocolate moose dessert. Even though I didn't pay for the pizza, I was extremely disappointed with its quality. I wish I took a picture of it. Extreme thin crust, a few pieces of small pineapples here and there, and all the ham were just plain (no applewood ones)!!!! I wouldn't be paying $13.99 for a crappy pizza like that. I couldn't really believe how CPK went down on the quality like that. Smh. The dessert was okay. It was around $6. It was super duper sweet plus overpriced. If I was dining alone, I wouldn't care about getting that. Since I felt so bad about this, I had a talk with one of the managers on 11/23/16. He promised to mail me some free coupons, and it had been over 2 weeks now! I don't think it takes a long time to receive them. He probably just wanted to lie about it in order to brush me off. Heh ... okay if that's how he wanted me gone ... I will be gone for good. No second chance to try them out. CPK asked for it, not me. Anyway, I had zero interest to deal with liars. I will just go back to Kroger to get their frozen pizzas. No worries. They are cheaper and taste 200% better than CPKs.

To go pizza was not ready when they said it would be. In fact I don't think it was even in the oven until I arrived. Soup sat out on the counterfor 25 minutes waiting for my pizza.   Food was just ok.

Just ok. Service - 4/5 - The restaurant was clean and the waiter was quite personable. Taste - 2/5  - Our order consisted of a bowl of potato soup and "The Works" pizza.  The soup was not white or cream colored as expected.  But almost the "golden" color.  Totally not what was expected.  The pizza was loaded with toppings just just lacked flavor.  I asked for a Cherry Coke and sent it back for a regular because it had a funny taste. Quality - 2/5 Although the portions were large, I felt the meal was overpriced.
Love their Chicken picatta pasta. You gotta try it!

The food we ordered was okay, but the ambience and service left something to be desired.  First of all, the music was far too loud, especially for families with small children.  There were at least 5 other tables with young children; the music level felt like we were at a club.  We had to yell to communicate at our table.  I spoke to the manager; he stated that the volume is "a set level at a set time."  My suggestion: change that level.  We dined at around 8p on a Saturday.  This wasn't an issue in the past. Secondly, we ordered Merlot and received Pinot Grigio.  We ordered kids spaghetti and got kids fusilli.  The waitress then suggested that we should have ordered "spaghettini."  I've never heard of confusion around the term spaghetti.  They did ultimately fix the food/drink errors and take the erroneous items off of the final balance by having them show as comped, but their suggested tip (the calculated values at the bottom of the receipt) included those erroneous items. I used to love this place but don't think I'll be back any time soon.
The pizza that we order was ok, nothing spectacular. However, I did like the salad. Our waiter was very nice which made the experience better.

I know this place has the word pizza in the title but to me its all about their salads! Location: Not great at all, its in memorial city mall and so if you're just wanting to go here then parking is awful. If you're in the mall walking around thats a great opportunity to grab some food. Food: Their pizzas are fine. Their salads are GREAT! Their thai salad is what dreams are made of. I try to get it every time i'm in town, however sometimes the thought of driving over there and finding parking is enough to deter me. The times I have eaten inside, the service is fine. Typical chain in the sense of the servers don't seem to care too much either way about what they are doing. Have never had excellent service, but equally haven't had awful service!

It was not event 50% full on Sunday night.  The service was slow as it took them almost 30 min to prepare: 1) a salad dish; 2) a pasta dish ; 3) a pizza and 4) medium rare ribeye.  It took them another 15 min to get a kid's BBQ pizza and 2 ice cream sundae.  You guessed it right: the ice cream were melted. There was no team work with the entire wait staff and the managers.  We waived to the staff at the counter for service, one staff got attention of another staff, who tried to get a a manager's attention.  And no one came until 5 min later came our waitress. As a chain, it is a typical issue with lack of leadership and management.

Was seated righ away. After almost 10 minutes of not a sole coming to the table , we decided to leave. We have been there several times before. Seems the staff was more interested in friends and other staff members than customers.

It was our first time going here and we had a great experience! The manager that took our drink order brought out a "surprise" for us when he found out it was our first ever visit here - a sample of the White Corn Guacamole and Chips. It was delicious and such a nice gesture! The pizza we got was the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage - also super delicious! The pizza comes with 6 slices as the menu says, although they are usually meant for one person since the crust is a lot thinner than you would expect. We shared our pizza and the Crispy Mac & Cheese appetizer, which turned out to be just enough food for the two of us. The staff was very helpful, with someone always stopping by to check on drink refills - even if they weren't our server. Would definitely recommend!

Very good pizza! We ordered the Five Cheese and Fresh Tomatoes without basil. It was great and very cheesy. The place was clean and the staff were kind and attentive. We just wanted a light tasty lunch and that was what we got. Price (11.95) was also good for 2 people.

What a horrible experience during lunch today (Keep in mind the restaurant was not busy or full housed), first my co-worker asked if a specific drink could exclude lime because she has a citrus allergy. The waitress said no, then said she would be back to provide us some complimentary bread. We waited almost 15 mins, then the manager comes over & says we can adjust the drink by this time it's too late so we ask the manager where the bread was, he said let me go check on that & we will be right back. He never returns, another 15 mins later our food comes out (no complimentary bread). The pizza was luke warm as its was sitting out for awhile.  At this point, I didn't want to ask them to remake because I'm in a rush & have to get back to work. I tell our waitress to rush our check as we were eating because we have to go. It's almost 20 mins later & their was some issue w/them splitting the check between 2 people. Finally, they get the bill sorted out & we pay then leave. I'm now walking with my co-worker & we both started feeling sick. Sadly enough this will probably be my last experience at this location.
My company has ordered from here twice for takeout. DO NOT order from here. Both times they forgot an entree and I had to drive all the way back to pick it up.
Went for lunch today, service and food was excellent, our waiter was new but did a fantastic job, manager came by to see how everything was, will definitely be back, thank you!

Every time I come here it's some shit! Like Johnny the manager a freaking joke! Like idk how the owners have people who are inconsistent with their job responsibilities still on pay role. I'm always waiting up to 45mins at curb side for my order and I only order the salmon pieces from here. The customer service sucks and they're ALWAYS TRYING to over charge me. This is my last time spending my time and money here. I'll take my hard earned funds where my time is respected and I don't receive cold food after waiting a lifetime for a call in order.
Great pizzas and salads! Nice atmosphere and tasty food! The bread could be less hard when served though. But definitely a good choice.

Unfortunately, this is one of my wife's favorite places to eat and it's the only location reasonably close to my house. As a result, they will most likely continue to get my business and disappoint. I've ordered with them multiple times, I've eaten inside a few times as well and either way, it's awful service. There's usually one single person running around doing everything while everyone else sits around, literally. I saw the hostesses sitting down behind the podium where the guests sit when they wait. Terrible. Every time I order, I either have to go in to get it or wait 10-15 minutes at curbside until they decide to bring out my cold food. I call in to order and sit on hold so long I hang up and call back in. The other thing that is frustrating is that if you actually make your own effort to get someone to help you, most of the employees will be rude and catch an attitude with you. If you are a patient person and LOVE this place, keep coming back. If you are going on a date or business dinner/lunch, don't go here. Service sucks, food is mediocre compared to other locations I've been to and they take FOREVER!

Lack of service and bad food. I threw up my pizza and appetizer hours later. Spinach dip was super salty and the works pizza was not worth. Should have ate the food court pizza :( something didn't sit right with my stomach after eating that and it all came back up and I felt better after it was out of my stomach lol only giving two stars because even tho the servers took forever to get our drinks and order, at least they were pretty nice.

Definitely, depends on the staff! The most horrible customer service today.  Nothing like feeling discriminated. Addressed my experience to the hostess and left.  No need to slice and dice this review. My rating speaks for itself. I just hope it's addressed or find new staff to this location.  Will not return. ******Update******* The manager called me the next day regarding my experience. He seems to know the issue, possibly it's a reoccurring matter that finally shed some light on. He told me to come back and be treated like a million bucks. LoL! Uh...no thanks! Just correct the problem.

We ordered the California to go so we could eat the pizza on the green and let our kid run around, open the box and there is NOTHING on the pizza but chicken... we had to go back get the toppings on the side and the pizza was cold and crust was soggy within just that few minutes and no offer of replacing. Way too overpriced for the quality.

We came here on a Saturday afternoon, got sat quickly!  We ordered 2 pizzas and one side salad along with a beer. Food taste is great, we loved the flavour of the pizzas and Caesar salad was not overly dressed!  Server Ruben was very attentive, always kept an eye on us, answer our questions and order cake up as we expected. By the end of our meal, we found a long hair on the last two slices. I did not want to say anything but my wife insisted. We got offered another meal by the manager who   us within seconds  but we actually didn't care much about it since we were almost done we our dinner, we finished the pizza anyway.  Manager applied a 20% discount even though we did not want anything else or ask for it. Thst was a nice touch of him. We took care of the servers tip to make up for it. Will be coming back soon

California Pizza kitchen is a good change from regular pizza places. They have a wide variety of off the charts pizza that are a relief from regular old pizza places. The ingredients are fresh and the bread is what makes this pizza. Bread in my opinion makes or breaks the pizza.
